name: One-bit Delta Sigma (or Sigma Delta) Audio Modulation; Direct Stream Digital (DSD; trade name)
definition: System for recreating audible signals using pulse-density modulation encoding known as Direct Stream Digital; the signal is stored as delta-sigma (some say "sigma delta") modulated digital audio, a sequence of single bit values at a high frequencies.   Used in Super Audio CDs (SACDs), developed by Sony in association with Philips and documented in the 1999 Scarlet Book.
